reviews.review_msg: The G.O.A.T. I've watched this guys online lectures instead of my actual profs for 3 different courses now. If this guy made quick, general-topic help videos for youtube he would have millions of subscribers, without a doubt.

jamie needs to learn how to teach. he talks so slow and explains so much unnecessary slog that you waste 90 percent of the time in lectures. he also offers no help outside of class so good luck. his exams are also impossible to do no matter how hard you study. avoid this prof at all costs!

Any superlatives you've seen are true - He is one of the best profs at SFU. He consistently stayed an extra hour after class. The course is well designed and the HWs were well connected to the exams. The grading was fair and timely (2days for midterms). Its a tough course but he provides all the opportunities for students to do well.

The other commentators didn't lie, Dr. Mulholland is one of the best professors in Math. He will go to great lengths to explain small details and provide explanation for every step, which is fantastic if you're someone who can get lost in the middle of a solution. He managed to make MACM201's difficulty bearable for me.
